Responsible Use of Technology: The Microsoft Case Study

This white paper, published in February 2021, examines the Microsoft case study as a practical application of responsible technology use. Developed in collaboration with the Markkula Center for Applied Ethics, the document explores how organizations can foster a culture of ethical innovation, particularly within the context of rapidly advancing technologies like artificial intelligence and machine learning. The core of the paper analyzes Microsoft's experiences and outlines a framework for change, emphasizing the importance of robust governance structures and clearly defined AI principles. The paper highlights the need for continuous monitoring and evaluation of cultural shifts, advocating for a multi-faceted approach to responsible innovation. It draws upon the World Economic Forum Centre for the Fourth Industrial Revolution‚Äôs work, established in 2017 to facilitate policy development and governance frameworks for emerging technologies. The document underscores the importance of a stakeholder-driven methodology, incorporating diverse perspectives to ensure responsible technology adoption. Furthermore, it addresses the challenges of measuring culture change and identifies key areas where further action is required. The white paper serves as a valuable resource for organizations seeking to integrate ethical considerations into their technology development processes, aligning with the broader goals of the World Economic Forum‚Äôs Centre for the Fourth Industrial Revolution. It provides a detailed case study and actionable insights for navigating the complexities of responsible AI and machine learning.

Key Concepts:

  • Co-creation of policy and governance frameworks through a multistakeholder approach
  • Applying responsible innovation practices
  • Measuring culture change
  • The Champs model involves appointing domain experts to promote responsible AI awareness and education.
  • The Ethics & Society team utilizes a design thinking approach to address ethical considerations in AI development.
  • Fairness focuses on developing AI systems that treat everyone in a fair and balanced way.
